alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 18 at 10:11AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 1000 AM THURSDAY UNTIL 800 PM THURSDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Sedgwick, Logan, Phillips, Weld, Morgan, Yuma and Washington Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Julesburg, Sterling, Holyoke, Fort Morgan, Wray and Akron. WHEN...1000 AM Thursday May 18 to 800 PM Thursday May 18 IMPACTS...Several large wildfires are burning in Canada, resulting in heavy smoke across several states. Northwesterly flow has brought smoke from Canadian wildfires into northeastern Colorado. Moderate to heavy smoke is possible today throughout northeastern Colorado. Smoke should decrease Thursday evening as showers and thunderstorms move through the area. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
